quoteFirst: Precautions were taken to prevent intrusion and powdered chalk was spread on the floor of the two smaller rooms, "to trace anybody or anything that might come or go." Mrs. Verrall knew nothing of the matter. The phenomena began at
quoteLast: and ended at 2:09 A.M. The watchers noticed marks on the powdered chalk. On examination it was seen that the marks were "clearly defined bird's footprints in the middle of the floor, three in the left-hand room and five in the right-hand room.
title: The Unknown Guest
author: Maeterlinck, Maurice, 1862-1949; Teixeira de Mattos, Alexander, 1865-1921 [Translator]

quoteFirst: The moon rises on the 15th at 12:39 a. m.; and sets on the 1st and 31st at 12:30 and
quoteLast: , respectively. On the 16th at 11:00 a. m., nearest the earth; on the 28th, at 5:30 p. m., farthest from the earth. Its greatest elevation, 67° 4′, occurs on the 15th, and its least, 29° 50.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 04, July 1884, No. 10
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]

quoteFirst: The phases for the month are as follows: Last quarter, 7th, at 9:34 a. m.; new moon, 15th, at
quoteLast: ; first quarter, 21st, at 6:12 p. m.; full moon, 29th, at 1:06 a. m. Rises on the 1st, at 8:38 p. m.; sets on the 16th, at 8:28 p. m.; rises on the 30th, at 8:21 p. m.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 05, April 1885
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]

quoteFirst: John's and Sydney, C. B., for Halifax, where they arrive in one hour and 20 minutes from London, or
quoteLast: by Constantinople time, but more than six hours earlier, or about 6.30 in the evening by Halifax time. They have therefore got ahead of the sun in his apparent journey round the world, for he had set for at least two hours when they started from Constantinople, but they caught up with him when over the Atlantic, and to the engineer it appeared as if he were rising in the west.
title: The Dominion in 1983
author: Centennius, Ralph
